title: Patrice Evra Reveals How Close He Came To Rejoining Manchester United
text:
Patrice Evra Reveals How Close He Came To Rejoining Manchester United Sat Feb 04 2017 12:57:28   12:57:28 GMT+0000 (GMT) Josh Lawless Josh Lawless in football 
Patrice Evra has revealed just how close he came to rejoining Manchester United in the January transfer window. 
The left-back lost his place in the Juventus side and so was available for a transfer last month and there were strong links with former club Manchester United. 
Evra spent eight years at Old Trafford between 2006 and 2014, winning five Premier League titles, three League Cups and one Champions League. 
And the Frenchman admits he was close to returning to United, prior to joining Marseille on loan. 
He acknowledge that he still has a strong connection with the United fans and spoke with Jose Mourinho, but did say that there is one unnamed person who was not in favour of him coming back for a second spell. 
Speaking to Sky Italia , he said: 
"I was very close to a return to Manchester United. I also spoke with Mourinho but there was a person, whose name I will not say, who probably did not like the idea of my return. 
"Even the fans were enthusiastic and would have been delighted, but because I realised that they [the club] would not do anything I then asked my agent to look for other teams. 
"Marseille immediately won me over with their project and immediately created a great feeling. We only spent one day to close the deal. They really treated me like a God, making it clear they had a great need for me." 
It's anyone's guess as to who this person was who played a part in Evra not rejoining. 
United fans are surely a bit gutted that the fan favourite didn't re-sign for the Red Devils and they won't be able to see him in an United shirt anytime soon. 
But at least they can still watch Evra having the time of his life on social media.
